title: Slab serif font by Stiftung Warentest
content:
Hello,

me as well as WhatTheFont keep failing on this one. It seems it is \*not\* American Typewriter Condensed Bold, what else could it possibly be? The logotype represents the german Stiftung Warentest ( [http://www.test.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112200759/http:/www.test.de/ "http://www.test.de")).

Any help appreciated :)

Thanks in advance,

Victor

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [test-small.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112200759/http:/typophile.com/files/test-small.jpg) | 41.54 KB |

 [‹ (x) Contenido: 6 bottelas - Eidetic Neo {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112200759/http:/typophile.com/node/15232 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Return of The Son of The Type ID Pop Quiz - The Sequel ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112200759/http:/typophile.com/node/6344 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rez

comments.content:
definitely not american typewriter.  
actually, this seems to be more special than it looks like. first off, i thought of some kind of bold condensed clarendon for the lowercase t has a classical appearance (chamfered top and upward ending). but the “stiftung warentest”-font has much less stroke contrast.  
maybe, this one is a custom-built logo typeface. but let’s hear other members’ opinions.

// alex
My vote goes to custom logo.

Thanks guys,

it was neither American Typewriter nor Clarendon nor Glypha, I would now go for custom, too. Eventually I had to rebuild this in Illustrator paths.  
Nevertheless, a big thank you for your effort :)

Cheers,

Victor
